@NFTethics is the hero we need but don't deserve

Another way that projects manage their treasuries is purely through smart contracts.

Smart contracts limit the flexibility in how funds can be used but are trustless because the funds can only be used for the programmed purpose.

Multisig wallets also offer wider flexibility than smart contracts in allowing projects to direct funds.

However, the main drawback of multisig wallets is that communities have to trust the majority of the signers.

What is a multisig?

Simply, a multisig is a wallet with multiple signers.

Because this is more secure than having a single signer, a lot of projects use multisigs to manage their treasuries.

Two common ways project treasuries are managed:

1) multisig wallets
2) smart contracts
What are the benefits and drawbacks of the common ways project treasuries are managed? A shortüßµüëá

8/8
Not mentioned so far are 1. the sheer number of integrations that $stETH has in the defi ecosystem and 2. the sustainability of the tokenomics of the $LDO token. While @LidoFinance is already the de facto leader, all of the above reasons point to their continued success

7/8
Node Operator Diversity. LIDO has a rigorous selection process for onboarding new validators which is 100% managed by the DAO. Please see their latest report on node operators:
https://t.co/mcXGFShwTq

6/x
DAO first. @LidoFinance is built off of @AragonProject and is one of the few projects that were ambitious enough to fully launch as a DAO. Launching a protocol of this magnitude with no "real-world" entity is not easy and it really speaks to the philosophy of the founders.

5/x
As a comparison - the ankrETH pool only has 28,000 ETH of TVL, and the pool is quite unbalanced (65% ankrETH) https://t.co/Y7KD3Eqbfj

4/x
Liquidity. $stETH is far and away the most liquid token amongst liquid staking providers. There is over 1.2mm ETH of TVL within the ETH/stETH pool on @CurveFinance. Plus the pool is very "balanced". (51% stETH) https://t.co/uqAqCOz7bp

3/x 
Firstly, LIDO is a juggernaut in the space. Based on this Dune dashboard by @eliasimos, they currently have an 89% marketshare amongst liquid staking solutions. (Higher if you exclude Stakehound, since this ETH is in purgatory‚òπÔ∏è)

https://t.co/ox4q2UjNXH

2/x
Our goals are to make @TheIdolsNFT as decentralized, un-censorable, secure and permission-less as possible. When you take these goals into consideration, there really is no other option besides @LidoFinance

RT @TheIdolsNFT: @DCLBlogger Founder compensation should be tied to the performance of the protocol and not simply vest over time
In order to grow into their valuations, many of these chains will need to increase their cost per tx. By the time that happens, what is the advantage of using these chains over Ethereum?

Alternative L1s will need to think about their business model because many of them can't even grow into their current valuations. While many of these chains can handle more TPS, there is an implicit cap on the cost per tx on these chains as their main selling point is being cheap

100% this. For those that know me this is an argument that I've been making for a long time. From a p/e ratio perspective, ETH trades in line with traditional web2 businesses like FB and GOOG even though Ethereum is expected to have magnitudes more growth. https://t.co/EG0WL7NdDs
